metadata.title: CVE-2016-0634 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The expansion of '\h' in the prompt string in bash 4.3 allows remoteauthenticated users to execute arbitrary code via shell metacharactersplaced in 'hostname' of a machine.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0634` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bash - 4.3-14ubuntu1.2
bash-builtins - 4.3-14ubuntu1.2
bash-static - 4.3-14ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bash package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3-14ubuntu1.2').
